unnormalised: **Builder Reviews: Are Homebuyers Finally Getting a Voice?**
normalised: Builder Reviews: Are Homebuyers Finally Getting a Voice?

unnormalised: Tired of just relying on brochures and builder promises? A new wave of websites and platforms are giving homebuyers in India the power to share their experiences, creating much-needed builder reviews. Think of it as TripAdvisor, but for your future home in Gurgaon or that investment property in Mumbai!
normalised: Tired of just relying on brochures and builder promises? Think of it as TripAdvisor, but for your future home in Gurgaon or that investment property in Mumbai!

unnormalised: Gone are the days when builders held all the cards. Now, potential buyers like Mrs. Sharma can read honest opinions on everything from construction quality (is that 2BHK really 1000 sq ft?) to post-sales service.
normalised: Gone are the days when builders held all the cards. Now, potential buyers like Missus Sharma can read honest opinions on everything from construction quality (is that two B H K really one thousand square feet?) to post sales service.

unnormalised: Several platforms are popping up, allowing users to rate builders on transparency, on-time delivery, and even the behaviour of their sales staff (we've all been there!).
normalised: Several platforms are popping up, allowing users to rate builders on transparency, on time delivery, and even the behavior of their sales staff (we have all been there!).

unnormalised: Experts like Dr. Patel from IIM Ahmedabad see this trend as a positive step towards greater accountability. "It's forcing builders to up their game. Bad reviews can seriously impact sales, especially in a competitive market like Bangalore."
normalised: Experts like Doctor Patel from I I M Ahmedabad see this trend as a positive step towards greater accountability. "It is forcing builders to up their game. Bad reviews can seriously impact sales, especially in a competitive market like Bangalore."

unnormalised: But be warned! As with all online reviews, take everything with a pinch of salt. Look for verified purchases and multiple perspectives. A Rs. 5 crore investment deserves your due diligence, right? Don't just believe everything you read; verify! Are these reviews truly independent or paid promotions? After all, building a home is a big decision, bigger than choosing between aloo paratha and dosa for breakfast.
